channel.title: Change Gmail sound or increase volume?
channel.description: So I sometimes get important messages in the middle of the night while I'm sleeping on gmail chat... the problem is that it's not always loud enough to wake me up. Even setting the volume to full (really loud through my speakers), I still sometimes don't hear them and sleep right through extremely important things. Is there a way that I can change the sound to be something a bit more aggressive, something that will detect I've gotten a message and blast something loud, or to increase the volume tenfold? Preferably some way to change the sound, but any will do. (I use Cockney Thug by Rusko as my alarm, it works wonders).

item.title: Change Gmail sound or increase volume?
item.dc:creator: @cooper cooper
item.description:
@cooper wrote:

[quote=“bootnecklad, post:12, topic:352224”][quote author=cooper link=topic=448578.msg3298400#msg3298400 date=1281109559]
Thanks for the tips, I worked something out.
[/quote]
Aren’t you going to tell us your solution? It’d be nice if you could tell us.[/quote]
I was going edit the post later, but forgot Thanks for the reminder.
I use the webclient because I use the sms feature from labs, what I ended up doing is using is a script with Sikuli. I’m not using that computer right now but when I get on it I can post the script.

Read full topic

item.source: Change Gmail sound or increase volume?

item.title: Change Gmail sound or increase volume?
item.dc:creator: @abraham2119 abraham2119
item.description:
@abraham2119 wrote:

Does it beep or play an actual sound? If it’s the former, the way I’d do it would be to setup a packet sniffer on whatever port the chat client receives data from, but if it’s the latter, it must load an audio file, which means you can use a program like “Process Explorer” to view all open file handles and such. Once you find the file you can just replace it with whatever you want. If for whatever reason the audio file is packed in an obscure manner which would require reversing the actual format, just go with the packet-sniffing approach.

Read full topic
item.source: Change Gmail sound or increase volume?

item.title: Change Gmail sound or increase volume?
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

Searched on google in case you didn’t and found nothing.
But there is 2 options I can think of, one is using a userscript(For your browser) to change the sound.
Number 2 is to make a program that detects important things on Gmail chat. and play a alarm on your PC.

Read full topic
